availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William C. Lemaster (Johnson County, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Johnson County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of James Lemaster. Married to Nucarius Lemaster. Father of Levi W. Lemaster, Mary A. Lemaster, James M. Lemaster, Jacob Lemaster, B. F. Lemaster, and Valandingham Lemaster. Farmer in Johnson County in 1850. Farmer in Johnson County in 1860. Private in the 65th Regiment of Kentucky Militia (U.S.A.) from May 21, 1864, to June 21, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, p. 87B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, p. 108.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, Flat Gap, p. 28.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registrations, 1863-1865, Kentucky, 9th Congressional District, Vol. 3, p. 95.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 897.
Kentucky Death Records on Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Roll #994043, Johnson County Deaths, p. 195.
